alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 2:43PM PST until January 06 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Additional snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches for the remainder of the day. Snow accumulations Wednesday through Thursday of 1 to 2 inches, with ice accumulations a tenth to two tenths inches possible. * WHERE...Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington and of Oregon. * WHEN...Until noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will start as a rain to snow mix Wednesday night. Best chance for freezing rain will be from approximately 1 AM PST to 7 AM PST Thursday morning, before transitioning to rain afterwards.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Oregon
